ca.eandb.jmist.framework.color

Interface Color

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface Color
extends Serializable
    An immutable sample from a Spectrum, which supports various mathematical operations.
    Author:
    Brad Kimmel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Color abs()
      A color whose luminance is the absolute value of the luminance of this color.
      Color clamp(double max)
      A color whose components are those of this color, bounded above by the specified value.
      Color clamp(double min, double max)
      A color whose components are those of this color, constrained to fall within the given range.
      Color disperse(int channel)
      A color for which all components but one are non-zero.
      Color divide(Color other)
      Divides this color by another.
      Color divide(double c)
      Divides this color by a constant.
      Color exp()
      A color of the same quality whose luminance is e raised to the luminance of this color.
      ColorModel getColorModel()
      The ColorModel that this Color came from.
      double getValue(int channel)
      Gets the value of a component of this color.
      WavelengthPacket getWavelengthPacket()
      The WavelengthPacket used to generate the sample from a Spectrum (may be null).
      Color invert()
      A color whose luminance is 1 - x, where x is the luminance of this color.
      double luminance()
      The intensity of this color.
      Color minus(Color other)
      Subtracts another color from this color.
      Color negative()
      A color whose luminance the negation of the luminance of this color.
      Color plus(Color other)
      Adds this color to another.
      Color pow(Color other)
      Raises this color to the power of another, componentwise.
      Color pow(double e)
      A color whose luminance is that of this color raised to a constant.
      Color sqrt()
      A color of the same quality whose luminance is the square root of the luminance of this color.
      Color times(Color other)
      Multiplies this color by another.
      Color times(double c)
      Multiplies this color by a constant.
      double[] toArray()
      The components of this Color.
      RGB toRGB()
      An RGB representation of this color.
      CIEXYZ toXYZ()
      The CIE XYZ tristimulus values indicating how this color appears to a human observer.

    • Method Detail

      • getWavelengthPacket

        WavelengthPacket getWavelengthPacket()
        The WavelengthPacket used to generate the sample from a Spectrum (may be null).
        Returns:
        The WavelengthPacket used to generate the sample from a Spectrum (may be null).

      • getColorModel

        ColorModel getColorModel()
        The ColorModel that this Color came from.
        Returns:
        The ColorModel that this Color came from.

      • times

        Color times(Color other)
        Multiplies this color by another.
        Parameters:
        other - The Color to multiply by.
        Returns:
        The product of this and other.

      • times

        Color times(double c)
        Multiplies this color by a constant.
        Parameters:
        c - The factor to multiply by.
        Returns:
        A Color equal to this Color times c.

      • divide

        Color divide(Color other)
        Divides this color by another.
        Parameters:
        other - The Color to divide by.
        Returns:
        The quotient of this and other.

      • divide

        Color divide(double c)
        Divides this color by a constant.
        Parameters:
        c - The factor to divide by.
        Returns:
        A Color equal to this Color divided by c.

      • plus

        Color plus(Color other)
        Adds this color to another.
        Parameters:
        other - The Color to add.
        Returns:
        The sum of this and other.

      • minus

        Color minus(Color other)
        Subtracts another color from this color.
        Parameters:
        other - The Color to subtract.
        Returns:
        The value of this minus other.

      • sqrt

        Color sqrt()
        A color of the same quality whose luminance is the square root of the luminance of this color.
        Returns:
        A Color of the same quality whose luminance is the square root of the luminance of this color.

      • exp

        Color exp()
        A color of the same quality whose luminance is e raised to the luminance of this color.
        Returns:
        A Color of the same quality whose luminance is e raised to the luminance of this color.

      • invert

        Color invert()
        A color whose luminance is 1 - x, where x is the luminance of this color.
        Returns:
        A Color whose luminance is 1 - x, where x is the luminance of this color.

      • negative

        Color negative()
        A color whose luminance the negation of the luminance of this color.
        Returns:
        A Color whose luminance the negation of the luminance of this color.

      • abs

        Color abs()
        A color whose luminance is the absolute value of the luminance of this color.
        Returns:
        A Color whose luminance is the absolute value of the luminance of this color.

      • pow

        Color pow(Color other)
        Raises this color to the power of another, componentwise.
        Parameters:
        other - The Color to raise this color to.
        Returns:
        A Color representing this color raised to the power of other, componentwise.

      • pow

        Color pow(double e)
        A color whose luminance is that of this color raised to a constant.
        Parameters:
        e - The exponent.
        Returns:
        A Color whose luminance is that of this color raised to a constant.

      • clamp

        Color clamp(double max)
        A color whose components are those of this color, bounded above by the specified value.
        Parameters:
        max - The maximum component value.
        Returns:
        A Color whose components do not exceed max.

      • clamp

        Color clamp(double min,
            double max)
        A color whose components are those of this color, constrained to fall within the given range.
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum component value.
        max - The maximum component value.
        Returns:
        A Color whose components satisfy min <= x <= max.

      • getValue

        double getValue(int channel)
        Gets the value of a component of this color.
        Parameters:
        channel - The index of the component to get.
        Returns:
        The component value.

      • disperse

        Color disperse(int channel)
        A color for which all components but one are non-zero. The value of the non-zero channel is equal to the value of the corresponding channel of this color.
        Parameters:
        channel - The index of the channel to keep.
        Returns:
        A Color with only one non-zero component.

      • luminance

        double luminance()
        The intensity of this color.
        Returns:
        The intensity of this color.

      • toArray

        double[] toArray()
        The components of this Color. The returned array shall not be the backing array (if there is one) for this Color (i.e., modifying the contents of the array will not affect this Color).
        Returns:
        The components of this Color.

      • toXYZ

        CIEXYZ toXYZ()
        The CIE XYZ tristimulus values indicating how this color appears to a human observer.
        Returns:
        The CIEXYZ tristimulus values indicating how this color appears to a human observer.

      • toRGB

        RGB toRGB()
        An RGB representation of this color.
        Returns:
        An RGB representation of this color.
